p: The model algorithm provided the best results based on the area under the receiver operating characteristic curve (AUC) values; AUC values for these curves varied from 0.941 to 0.971. For both species, the most suitable area climatically (0.54 < P < 1) from the current prediction (601,927 km 2) was obviously larger than that from the last glacial maximum (LGM) prediction (564,288 km 2) and the last interglacial (LIG, 347,475 km 2) predictions; similar patterns were identified for all suitable areas (P > 0.05) (Fig. 5a,b and c). Obviously, climatically suitable areas from prediction expanded during the Quaternary period.
